context.p: You can convert any part of document content to a reference to a newly-declared internal entity.

step.cmd: Select content for the internal entity.

info.p: Select what to convert to an internal entity in the Editing Window or in the ContentMap.

fig.title: Content selected in the Editing Window.

step.cmd: Call up the Convert to Internal Entity Dialog.

info.p: To call up the Convert to Internal Entity Dialog, do one of the following:

choice.p: Choose Entity Convert to Internal Entity .
Right-click the selection and select Convert to Internal Entity from the context menu.

stepresult.p: The Convert to Internal Entity Dialog will appear.

step.cmd: Specify the name of the entity.

info.p: In the Entity Name field, enter the name of the new internal entity.

step.cmd: Convert the selection to the internal entity.

info.p: To convert the selection to the internal entity, click OK.

note.p: If an entity with the same name already exists, the error message will appear. Click OK and specify another entity name.

stepresult.p: The internal entity will be declared in the document and the internal entity reference will be inserted.

fig.title: Content converted to an internal entity.

stepresult.p: You can insert more references to the declared internal entity. You can also convert the document portion back from the internal entity into a regular content, change the internal entity declaration or remove the internal entity declaration.
